headline: Bangladesh seeks democratic renewal in first post-uprising election
subhead: On Thursday, the country will vote in the first legislative elections since the 2024 student uprising that ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina. Bangladeshis will choose between a right-wing party dominated by a single family for decades and an Islamist party.

headline: Trump tells Israel's Netanyahu 'negotiations with Iran must continue'
In East Jerusalem, 'the Israelis are suffocating us because there is no longer any international pressure'
'The Washington Post became the collateral damage ofJeff Bezos's choice to forge the strongest possible ties with Trump'
subhead: There is a clear parallel between the opposing choices of two media owners: Jimmy Lai, the pro-democracy resistance figure in Hong Kong, and Jeff Bezos, the owner of the 'Washington Post,' writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

headline: 2026 could quickly become deadliest year for migrants crossing the Mediterranean
subhead: From January 1 to February 10, at least 524 migrants died or were reported missing after attempting the crossing from North Africa to Europe.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: France's Cizeron and Fournier Beaudry snatch ice dancing gold
subhead: Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry concluded their competition with a mesmerizing routine set to the powerful soundtrack of the 2022 film 'The Whale.' They finished 1.43 points ahead of the USA's three-time world champions Madison Chock and Evan Bates.

headline: Astronaut Sophie Adenot prepares for her first takeoff
subhead: At 43, this seasoned helicopter pilot is about to become the 11th French person – and only the second French woman – to travel to space. She will spend eight months aboard the International Space Station, setting a record for a European.

'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

headline: Macron's failed bet to achieve full employment by 2027
subhead: The French president set a goal of reducing the unemployment rate to 5% by the end of his second term. That target has become unattainable according to figures from the national statistics office published on Tuesday, which show a 0.6-point increase over the past year, reaching 7.9%.

headline: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

headline: The urgent need for a European strategy on economic sovereignty
'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
